title: [Self-directed] Workshop on Building a Scientific Digital Repository for Summer Internship Project Reports: Strengthening Experimental Data and Evidence-Based Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital document management experience, smartphone utilization skills, foundational scientific observation/recording understanding, basic experimental data measurement/analysis skills
context.additional_context: Learning to build scientific digital repositories using open-source tools in smartphone-centric constrained technology environments. Learners improve report management processes based on practical science field experiences (experimental data management, research report writing), with special focus on systematic storage and analyzability of measurement data. Also supports evidence collection and conclusion-drawing processes for hypothesis verification.

learning_goals: Systematically collect and analyze summer internship project reports using open-source software (Greenstone) while scientifically managing experimental data variables.
Apply methods to enhance search efficiency and scientific evidence-based accessibility of reports according to metadata input standards.

Acquire practical competencies to operate and maintain a digital repository using only smartphones in limited technological environments, while managing variables in observational records and measurement data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
